newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Palestinians strike against Israeli building plan.
newsitem.headline: Palestinians strike against Israeli building plan.

text.p: Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza Strip observed a general strike on Monday to protest against Israeli plans to build more housing for Jews in Arab East Jerusalem.

Shops, businesses, schools and Palestinian government offices across the West Bank and Gaza Strip were shut, heeding a call by the Palestinian Legislative Council issued at an emergency meeting last week.
In East Jerusalem, traffic was light as shops and businesses were shut by the strike.

The government of Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu last week gave the green light for construction of the first stage of a 6,500 unit housing project on Jabal Abu Ghneim, known in Israel as Har Homa.
The decision, which effectively completes a ring of Jewish settlements around Arab East Jerusalem and cuts off the southern part of the West Bank from the north, outraged Palestinians.
Israel captured East Jerusalem in the 1967 Middle East war and annexed it in a move not recognised by the international community. Palestinians want to establish the capital of a future state there.
Palestinians have been holding peaceful protests near the pine forest hill on the southern edge of Jerusalem since the decision.
General strikes were a main method of Palestinian protest during an uprising against Israeli rule which erupted in 1987 and ended after Israel and the PLO signed a self-rule deal in 1993.
